block.p: ALCOA INC., Pittsburgh, the biggest maker of aluminum, said it fired 77 workers, or about one-fifth of its 350 workers, at the Hernando, Miss., plant that makes aluminum parts because of a slowdown in construction.

WATSCO INC., Coconut Grove, Fla., a distributor of air conditioning and heating products, said it had agreed to buy the closely held S.W. Anderson Sales Corp., Farmingdale, N.Y., for an undisclosed amount of cash and stock to expand its distribution network.

WATSCO INC., Coconut Grove, Fla., a distributor of air conditioning and heating products, said it had agreed to buy the closely held S.W. Anderson Sales Corp., Farmingdale, N.Y., for an undisclosed amount of cash and stock to expand its distribution network.

AMERICAN HOME PRODUCTS CORP., Madison, N.J., will pay about $350 million to settle more than 3,000 claims by women -- most in Mississippi and Alabama -- who accused the company of hiding the health risks of the company's fen-phen diet drug combination of Pondimin and Redux, people familiar with the agreement said.

WEATHERFORD INTERNATIONAL INC., Houston, an oil field services company, agreed to buy a 48 percent stake in Universal Compression Holdings Inc., also of Houston, for about $360 million to create the second-largest provider of natural gas compression services.
